title: Business & Finance
text:
Tencent's largest shareholder, Prosus, is selling up to $14.7 billion of stock in the Chinese internet and videogaming giant.

---

Two private-equity firms have teamed up to make a bid for KPN that could value the Dutch telecom company at over $15 billion.

---

Fed officials pointed to a brighter outlook for the economy at their most-recent meeting, while agreeing to provide continued policy support, minutes show.

---

JPMorgan 's Dimon said the U.S. economy is emerging from the coronavirus pandemic into a boom that could last until 2023.

---

The S&P 500 rose 0.1% to close at a record. The Dow edged up 0.05%, while the Nasdaq slipped 0.1%.

---

An SEC official warned about the surge in fundraising by special-purpose acquisition companies.

---

Cameras in Tesla vehicles aren't activated outside of North America, the company said, as it aims to ease privacy concerns in China.
